column10: I was stepping into the crosswalk to cross Slaters just after cresting the bridge on Route 1 when a driver failed to stop at the right light nearly hitting me. The driver was looking left to turn on red when she nearly hit me.

Multiple drivers failed to yield to two cyclists and a pedestrian trying to cross Slater’s Lane. We finally go only to have a car almost hit the cyclists. I waved to try and get his attention. And he swerved around me, brushing me with his vehicle.
Cars making right onto Slaters Lane from Richmond Highway are speeding through crosswalk; Commenter nearly hit during evening run when car made left turn onto Slater's lane

SUV that was speeding north on route 1 made a last minute shift to the right turn lane and turned at a very high speed. I was already in the crosswalk and had to scramble back onto the sidewalk to avoid being hit. I was well-lit and visible.
Vehicle was coming down ramp from route 1 and almost clipped me while I was using the unprotected bike lane on E Monroe Ave. They then stopped in the middle of the bike lane..
Cars traveling south on Richmond Highway and making left onto Slaters and/or cars traveling North on Richmond Highway and making right onto Slaters are both not looking for pedestrians
Cars turning right onto Slater's Lane from Richmond Highway are easily exceeding 25 mph. Even when they see pedestrian i crosswalk, they accelerate.

I was mid-crosswalk when a driver in a red car traveling north in the right turn lane sped up to turn directly in front of me. I was hearing a headlamp, a vest with blinking lights yet the driver claimed she didn’t see me.
Drivers turning right on red off Slaters Lane onto Route 1 do NOT look right to the sidewalk. I have been almost hit several times
had crosswalk light. driver in crosswalk and tried to move forward while we were crossing
Car was speeding north on Route 1 and took a sharp right turn onto Slater's Lane without noticing that I had stepped into the crosswalk. I was trying to cross Slater's also heading north on Route 1.

The cars that turn left off of Route 1 onto Slaters Lane do not respect the cross walk signals for pedestrians crossing over Slaters Lane. I am frequently either not allowed to walk when I have the walk sign because so many cars are trying to turn left OR am almost hit when I do and CLEARLY have a white walk signal.
column21: I don't know why it's so hard for the cars turning left to look for the pedestrian signs, but it seems to be difficult for them. It's fine when they have a left arrow but when they just have a green light, they seem to think that pedestrians wouldn't have the right of way.
column26: 709 Massey Lane, Unit B Alexandria, VA 22314

column10:
Intersection of Monroe and main line drive. 

Cyclist coming from Monroe to join the trail southbound was not paying attention when merging onto trail. He rolled onto the bike trail and nearly smashed into me as I traveled southbound. He had a child in a seat on the back of his bike
